subject: Re: [junit] Whether I must extends TestCase?
msgSnippet: I have found one case where extending a production class with a test class to be useful.  In a web environment under .Net you have the notion of a code-behind.
messageBody:
I have found one case where extending a production class with a test
class to be useful. In a web environment under .Net you have the
notion of a code-behind. This code-behind represents in code the page
which will be served to the browser (so you have Table, Button and
Form objects).

From a testing perspective it is much more natural for our team to
call the page's methods in a similar fashion as the web contrainer
would.

Examples include the OnInit(), Page_Load() and
buttonDoSomething_click() methods.



On Thu, 15 Jul 2004 10:41:42 +0800 (CST),
�ffffd2�fffffc�ffffce�ffffb0�ffffc3�fffffa <yinwm2000@...>
wrote:
> If I can extends my product class. I can get lots of
> things from my superclass.
> I just want to make a simple test case, so I want to
> do that so.
>
> --- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> 的正文：
> ---------------------------------
> �ffffd2�fffffc�ffffce�ffffb0�ffffc3�fffffa
> wrote:
>
> > I want to test a package. If I extends my own
> class,
> > it will save me lots of time. :)
>
> This is interesting. I have never wanted my test class
> to extend a
> production code class. More strongly, test code should
> be a client of
> production code, and not the other way around. Why
> would this save you time?
> --
